value.string:
"""
 Create new Content by cloning an existing document
 or by creating a new document.
 
 This script is called by the admin toolbox.
 """
 
 form_data = context.REQUEST.form
 
 # Define a list of field name to ignore in the cloning process
 ACCEPTABLE_FORM_ID_LIST = [ \
 'reference'
 , 'language'
 , 'version'
 , 'revision'
 , 'title'
 , 'short_title'
 ]
 
 # Clone properties to the new object
 kw = {}
 property_id_list = context.propertyIds()
 for (key, val) in form_data.items():
 if key in ACCEPTABLE_FORM_ID_LIST and key in property_id_list:
 kw[key] = val
 new_object.edit(**kw)
 
 # First make sure that no document already exists with the
 # same portal_type, reference, language and version.
 if clone:
 portal_type = context.getPortalType()
 else:
 portal_type = form_data['new_portal_type']
 
 portal_catalog(portal_type=portal_type, reference=reference, ) 
 
 
 # Standard cloning method
 if clone:
 
 
 
 # TODO ?: If the document language hasn't changed and the version wasn't increased,
 # change the copied document reference to "copy-of-%s". This idea came from
 # the fact some published document are "invisible" because cloned documents
 # share by default the same reference (within a set of documents of same
 # references in a given section, only one document is display).
 
 # We copy contents in place if possible
 directory = getattr(context, 'original_container', None) or context.getParentValue()
 
 # Copy and paste the object
 original_id = getattr(context, 'original_id', None) or context.getId() # This is required for objects acquired in Web Section
 clipboard = directory.manage_copyObjects(ids=[original_id])
 #context.log("Kev test clipboard >>>>>", repr(clipboard))
 paste_result = directory.manage_pasteObjects(cb_copy_data=clipboard)
 new_object = directory[paste_result[0]['new_id']]
 
 #context.log("Kev test paste_result >>>>>", repr(paste_result))
 #context.log("Kev test directory.WebSite_getUrl() >>>>>", repr(directory.WebSite_getUrl()))
 #context.log("Kev test new_object.getId() >>>>>", repr(new_object.getId()))
 
 redirect_url = '%s/view?editable_mode=1' % new_object.absolute_url()
 
 # Create a new object here (this is a copy and paste of the previous WebSite_clone script)
 else:
 # Guess the new document module
 portal = context.getPortalObject()
 module = portal.getDefaultModule(portal_type=portal_type)
 new_object = module.newContent(portal_type = portal_type)
 redirect_url = '%s/view?editable_mode=1' % new_object.absolute_url()
 
 
 # Clone properties to the new object
 kw = {}
 property_id_list = new_object.propertyIds()
 for (key, val) in form_data.items():
 if key in ACCEPTABLE_FORM_ID_LIST and key in property_id_list:
 kw[key] = val
 new_object.edit(**kw)
 
 
 return context.REQUEST.RESPONSE.redirect(redirect_url)
